Sentencas: Experiments using a model gas mixture which is chosen to represent hydrocarbon fuel from hydrothermal gasification of biomass were carried out under gas-phase conditions similar to those expected in the anode channel of a solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: Ethane conversion and product formation were evaluated from the measurements at various temperatures ranging from 610 degrees C to 860 degrees C and at a total pressure of 1.2 bar.
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: The employed reactor was simulated using a plug-flow model coupled to a detailed gas-phase reaction mechanism.
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: The measured temperature profile along the reactor was imported in the calculation routine.
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: A satisfying agreement in both ethane conversion and product composition was reached between the model predictions and the experimental data.
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: In order to determine which reactions were responsible for much of the observed kinetics a sensitivity analysis based on the rate of production (ROP) principle was performed.
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study

Sentencas: The results from the sensitivity analysis show that there are only six elementary reactions whose rates significantly affect the consumption or formation of the four species of interest, i.e. H(2), CH(4), C(2)H(4) and C(2)H(6).
Titulo: Investigations on gas-phase reactions of ethane under SOFC conditions: An experimental and modeling study
